accessLevel.description: The default value is false. True indicates that the task is private.
accessLevel.name: accessLevel

actualTime.timeSpan.description: The Actual Time field shows the total amount of time entered against this task.
actualTime.timeSpan.name: actualTime.timeSpan

assigned.externalId.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
assigned.externalId.name: assigned.externalId

assigned.internalId.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
assigned.internalId.name: assigned.internalId

assigned.name.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
assigned.name.name: assigned.name

company.externalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
company.externalId.name: company.externalId

company.internalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
company.internalId.name: company.internalId

company.name.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
company.name.name: company.name

completedDate.description: Enter the date this task was actually completed.
completedDate.name: completedDate

contact.externalId.description: Select the contact for this task.The contacts in this field are the contacts attached to the company selected above. Click Open next to the Company field to add contacts to a company's record.You can select additional companies and contacts on the Contacts subtab.
contact.externalId.name: contact.externalId

contact.internalId.description: Select the contact for this task.The contacts in this field are the contacts attached to the company selected above. Click Open next to the Company field to add contacts to a company's record.You can select additional companies and contacts on the Contacts subtab.
contact.internalId.name: contact.internalId

contact.name.description: Select the contact for this task.The contacts in this field are the contacts attached to the company selected above. Click Open next to the Company field to add contacts to a company's record.You can select additional companies and contacts on the Contacts subtab.
contact.name.name: contact.name

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

dueDate.description: Enter the projected date when this task needs to be complete.
dueDate.name: dueDate

endDate.description: This field is required in the UI but not when submitting requests via Web services.
endDate.name: endDate

estimatedTime.timeSpan.description: In the Initial Time Budget field, enter your first approximation of the amount of time this task will take. Later, you can increase or decrease your time estimate in the Current Time Budget field. By maintaining an initial time estimate in this field, you can compare your initial estimate to your altered estimate. If you entered a time estimate on a job task template, that amount shows here.
estimatedTime.timeSpan.name: estimatedTime.timeSpan

estimatedTimeOverride.timeSpan.description: If your estimate of the time this task will take increases or decreases from your original estimate, enter the altered estimate in the Current Time Budget field.
estimatedTimeOverride.timeSpan.name: estimatedTimeOverride.timeSpan

message.description: Enter any comments about this task.These comments appear in the e-mail sent to the person this task is assigned to.
message.name: message

milestone.externalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
milestone.externalId.name: milestone.externalId

milestone.internalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
milestone.internalId.name: milestone.internalId

milestone.name.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
milestone.name.name: milestone.name

owner.externalId.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account. The field defaults to the current user.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
owner.externalId.name: owner.externalId

owner.internalId.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account. The field defaults to the current user.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
owner.internalId.name: owner.internalId

owner.name.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account. The field defaults to the current user.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
owner.name.name: owner.name

parent.externalId.description: Select the parent task if this task is the subordinate of another.Note: By identifying this task as a subordinate, the parent task becomes a summary task. A summary task cannot have resources assigned to it because it does not track work, it only tracks information about subordinate tasks.
parent.externalId.name: parent.externalId

parent.internalId.description: Select the parent task if this task is the subordinate of another.Note: By identifying this task as a subordinate, the parent task becomes a summary task. A summary task cannot have resources assigned to it because it does not track work, it only tracks information about subordinate tasks.
parent.internalId.name: parent.internalId

parent.name.description: Select the parent task if this task is the subordinate of another.Note: By identifying this task as a subordinate, the parent task becomes a summary task. A summary task cannot have resources assigned to it because it does not track work, it only tracks information about subordinate tasks.
parent.name.name: parent.name

percentComplete.description: In the Percent Complete field, enter an estimate of how much of the total amount of work for this task is already completed. For example, if half the work toward completion is done, enter 50%. Note: The percentage you enter in this field overrides the auto-calculated figure in the Percent Time Complete field and is used for task calculations.
percentComplete.name: percentComplete

percentTimeComplete.description: The system auto-calculates a value for the Percent Time Complete field, by dividing Actual Time by Current Time Budget (or by Initial Time Budget, if no Current Time Budget has been entered). This value indicates how much of the budgeted time for the task has been completed.You can override this value by entering a percentage value in the Percent Complete field.
percentTimeComplete.name: percentTimeComplete

priority.value.description: The values used to populate this field are _low, _medium or _high.
priority.value.name: priority.value

reminderMinutes.value.description: This field is settable only if timedEvent is set to TRUE.
reminderMinutes.value.name: reminderMinutes.value

reminderType.value.description: This field is settable only if timedEvent is set to TRUE.
reminderType.value.name: reminderType.value

startDate.description: This field has a default value of the current date and time. It is required in the UI but not when submitting requests via Web services.
startDate.name: startDate

status.value.description: The values used to populate this field are _notStarted, _inProgress or _completed.
status.value.name: status.value

supportCase.externalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
supportCase.externalId.name: supportCase.externalId

supportCase.internalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
supportCase.internalId.name: supportCase.internalId

supportCase.name.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
supportCase.name.name: supportCase.name

timeRemaining.timeSpan.description: The Time Remaining field shows the estimated remaining amount of time for this task. Time remaining is calculated as follows:(Initial Time Budget - Actual Time)If you have entered a Current Time Budget to update your Initial Time Budget, then the time remaining for the task is calculated as:(Current Time Budget - Actual Time)
timeRemaining.timeSpan.name: timeRemaining.timeSpan

timedEvent.description: In Web services the startTime and endTime field are not exposed. Therefore, to set start and end times for a timed task, users must first set the timedEvent field to TRUE. Then the time component of the DateTime value that is specified in startDate will be set for startTime, and the time component of the DateTime value that is specified in endDate will be set for endTime. Note that the fields reminderMinutes and reminderType are also only settable if timedEvent is set to TRUE.
timedEvent.name: timedEvent

title.description: Enter a name for this task.This name is the subject line of the e-mail sent to the assignee if you check the Send e-mail box.This title also appears to others if the Private Task box is not checked. The title shows on the Tasks list.
title.name: title

transaction.externalId.description: References an opportunity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
transaction.externalId.name: transaction.externalId

transaction.internalId.description: References an opportunity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
transaction.internalId.name: transaction.internalId

transaction.name.description: References an opportunity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
transaction.name.name: transaction.name

type.value.description: References an opportunity record that already exists in your account.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
type.value.name: type.value

unit.value.description: In the Initial Time Budget field, enter your first approximation of the amount of time this task will take. Later, you can increase or decrease your time estimate in the Current Time Budget field. By maintaining an initial time estimate in this field, you can compare your initial estimate to your altered estimate. If you entered a time estimate on a job task template, that amount shows here.
unit.value.name: unit.value
